text: RT @SenBooker All Americans—Republicans & Democrats—are all being hurt by the government shutdown that was caused by President Trump's demand for an ineffective & wasteful border wall. Trump must end his #TrumpShutdown now.  https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1078270786211905537 QT @thehill Trump: "Most of the people not getting paid" in shutdown are Democrats https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/422952-trump-most-of-the-people-not-getting-paid-in-shutdown-are-democrats http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DvbJkMCWkAAjhX4.jpg

RT @SenBooker 8-year-old Felipe Alonzo-Gómez is the second child this month to die in #CBP custody under this admin. This is horrifying. My heart breaks for these young children & their families. We need answers—our government has a responsibility to keep children safe. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1077633355800301568 QT @washingtonpost A migrant child in U.S. custody has died in New Mexico, Customs and Border Protection officials said https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/national/wp/2018/12/25/a-migrant-child-in-u-s-custody-has-died-in-new-mexico-customs-and-border-protection-officials-said/

RT @SenBooker President Trump said he would be ‘proud’ to shut down the government over his senseless & wasteful border wall—but real people & families are being hurt including low-wage workers who likely won’t get back pay. Trump must end his #TrumpShutdown now. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2018/12/24/partial-shutdown-is-total-failure-it-could-last-until-new-year/?noredirect=on

RT @SenBooker Due to the #TrumpShutdown—420,000 federal workers will be forced to work without pay & another 380,000 federal workers will be sent home over the holidays without pay. ~5,000 NJ workers are affected. This was avoidable. Trump must reopen the government. https://twitter.com/CBSNews/status/1076489998961119232 QT @CBSNews The government shutdown that started Saturday affects 800,000 federal employees, who will either be furloughed or work without pay before Christmas. Follow live updates on the shutdown and its impacts: https://www.cbsnews.com/live-news/government-shutdown-2018-deadline-passed-meaning-latest-live-updates/?ftag=CNM-00-10aab7e&linkId=61473608 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DvB18wVWkAAWnsa.jpg

Herod...ordered the massacre of all the boys in Bethlehem...Then was fulfilled what had been said through Jeremiah... 

“A voice was heard in Ramah, sobbing & loud lamentation; Rachel weeping for her children & she would not be consoled,since they were no more.”

Mt 2:16-18

RT @Anna_Giaritelli Texas politicians @GovAbbott @SenTedCruz @JohnCornyn @RepMcCaul honor WWII veteran and Austin resident Richard Overton, 'American icon' dead at 112 https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/politicians-honor-wwii-veteran-richard-overton-american-icon-dead-at-112

RT @armyfutures The @USArmy’s oldest #WWII Soldier, Richard Overton has passed away at the age of 112. AFC would like to send our deepest condolences to the family and friends of Mr. Overton for his dedication to duty and years of selfless service to this great Nation. http://www.cnn.com/2018/12/27/us/richard-overton-oldest-ww-ii-vet-died/index.html http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DvfGN_OXQAAy5Oh.jpg

RT @theGrio EXCLUSIVE: Senator @CoryBooker explains what the passing of the FIRST STEP Act really means for America's broken prison system. 

There's much ground to cover on the road to justice reform.

https://thegrio.com/2018/12/21/cory-booker-criminal-justice-reform-bill-long-way-to-go/

RT @SenBooker This is deeply concerning—the Violence Against Women Act, which provides critical resources for survivors of domestic violence & sexual assault, expired with the government shutdown. This #TrumpShutdown must end. https://twitter.com/civilrightsorg/status/1076858882906095616 QT @civilrightsorg Don’t forget what else the #TrumpShutdown means: https://www.rollcall.com/news/politics/violence-against-women-act-lapse

RT @cut_50 “Cory Booker is a champion for criminal justice reform. His support of the FIRST STEP Act proves what Washington can accomplish when it puts partisan politics aside."  @EricaJedynak

True story, thanks @CoryBooker #FirstStepAct https://www.insidernj.com/press-release/afp-nj-senator-booker-gave-new-jerseyans-great-gift/

RT @SenBooker The #TrumpShutdown has left hundreds of thousands of workers wondering when they'll be paid at a time when they should be enjoying Christmas & the holiday season with their families.
 https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2018/12/21/she-wanted-buy-her-grandkids-bike-christmas-now-shutdown-looms/?noredirect=on&utm_term=.392805524515

RT @ScottHech The cycle:

1. Arrested because poor. 
2. Court fees imposed. Can’t afford.
3. License suspended for not paying.
4. Need car for work, appointments.
5. Arrested for driving w/o license.
6. Court fees imposed. Can’t afford.
7. Rinse. Repeat.

Governors: Take note of Virginia👇 https://twitter.com/brandonlgarrett/status/1076091663817293824 QT @brandonlgarrett Virginia plans to end driver’s license suspensions for court debt, governor says https://wapo.st/2EJ1H1u?tid=ss_tw&utm_term=.ed58a10735fd

RT @KOKEFMAUSTIN We are saddened to inform you that we have just lost our beloved and nation's treasure Richard Arvin Overton today at 112 years old. 

"You don't know when you get here, you don't know when you go, it's in God's hands" - Richard Overton http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DvdvOzaUwAEyetf.jpg

RT @ACLU In Lexington County, SC, people are being jailed without ever seeing a judge, being given a court hearing, or receiving help from a lawyer. For mothers of color and others ensnared in this debtors’ prison, the consequences are devastating. https://www.aclu.org/blog/racial-justice/race-and-criminal-justice/single-moms-get-sucked-cruelest-debtors-prison-weve?fbclid=IwAR0ho8FJ4For8c4vbF3FJVzA7KuBYxktuf1nOxqFzqFPwOqjKn5Zpuh51Aw
We have accomplished incredible policy victories over the last 2 years for Florida and our nation. Watch live as I discuss my fight for #Florida. https://www.facebook.com/SenatorMarcoRubio/

This isn’t a game — the shutdown is directly affecting people’s livelihood. They’re hardworking Americans trying to make our country a better place and they deserve to be able to work with pay. 
https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1078270786211905537 QT @thehill Trump: "Most of the people not getting paid" in shutdown are Democrats https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/422952-trump-most-of-the-people-not-getting-paid-in-shutdown-are-democrats?__twitter_impression=true http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DvbJkMCWkAAjhX4.jpg

As we near end of current Congress I am very proud of what we achieved for the people of #Florida. 

27 of my bills became law,we influenced policy on #Cuba & #Venezuela & secured key funding for the #Everglades & disaster relief. 

Watch here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lh2ByhRO840&feature=youtu.be 

#Sayfie

The American people are tired of a president who is a liar, a fraud, a narcissist and a bully. They want leadership which unites us, not divides us. They want policies which work for all, not just the wealthy few.

It is an international embarrassment that we have more people locked up in jail than any other country on earth. That has got to end. We must become the country in the world which invests in jobs and education, not in more jails and incarceration. https://www.cbsnews.com/news/report-finds-nearly-half-of-u-s-adults-have-had-an-immediate-family-member-incarcerated/

The past two years I’ve been fighting for #Florida. We’ve achieved some major wins for our state, and will continue to build upon this for years to come. #sayfie http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1078695315102945280/img/nxzc1krtDdlFDHbE.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1078695315102945280/vid/320x180/EKBaHDnii_QfEVUC.mp4?tag=9

RT @JenGranholm #TrumpShutdown 

“We will vote swiftly to reopen government and show that Democrats will govern responsibly in stark contrast to this chaotic White House” -- @NancyPelosi 

https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/27/us/politics/government-shutdown-trump-democrats.html @TeamPelosi @HouseDemocrats

RT @IlhanMN Our President is threatening to shut down the southern border over funding for his $5,000,000,000 wall. Experts say doing so would cost our economy hundreds of millions of dollars a day, maybe over a billion.

This isn't leadership, it's the world's most expensive temper tantrum.

RT @HaleyLive It’s time to cut the crap.  

As a soon to be voting Member of Congress, I will vote to reopen the government, I will work with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to pass a budget, and I will wholly oppose border policies that hurt our economy and communities. 

Enough. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1078396130969427968 QT @thehill Government shutdown to continue through next week https://thehill.com/policy/finance/423030-shutdown-to-drag-on-with-no-house-votes-expected-this-week http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dvc7kNTX4AIjg3R.jpg

RT @keithboykin Trump lied to America when he said Mexico would pay for his border wall, and he lied to his base when he said the Republican Congress would get it done the past two years. So now he shuts down the government because Democrats won’t bail him out from the consequences of his lies. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1078718219358216193/pu/img/BlZ-nsokDx8hq-7F.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1078718219358216193/pu/vid/320x180/gDBLYM3jJrkZdni8.mp4?tag=6

RT @RabbiJill This is what leadership looks like 👇🏽👇🏽👇🏽 @TeamPelosi https://twitter.com/johnlundin/status/1078717815652315137 QT @johnlundin This just in: Nancy Pelosi said Friday that the climate panel she's setting up as Democrats assume House control will be called the 'Select Committee on the #Climate Crisis'. Rep. Kathy Castor (D-Fla.) will chair the select committee.  - http://ir.shareaholic.com/e?a=1&u=https://www.axios.com/pelosi-says-new-committee-aimed-at-climate-cris-1546012947-00da5471-0e13-4e99-a1e9-8e170a0dd3e4.html%3Futm_source%3Dfacebook%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Dorganic%26utm_content%3D1100%26fbclid%3DIwAR191NdyFLcbsNdqHGOm8mIb_aX1USOLiJgLwv_ny1cxRrxOLlT9-7wjVAk&r=1 #FridayThoughts

Republicans still control the White House, the Senate, and the House.

RT @cmarinucci The cost of border shutdown to California jobs, businesses, communities and familiies would be huge...The shutdown at San Ysidro Port of Entry in November cost local biz more than $5.3 million -- and that was just 5 hours. https://twitter.com/tedlieu/status/1078667155187482626 QT @tedlieu Dear @GOPLeader McCarthy (R-CA): I will leave it up to you to tell California businesses that the leader of the Republican party--@realDonaldTrump--wants to shut down all trade along California's southern border. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1078625779670503426

Julie’s a single mother who has taken extra shifts at Barnes and Noble since the government shutdown. “It’s not going to pay all my bills, but it will help put food on the table.” #ShutdownStories

RT @RepBrendanBoyle Meanwhile 800,000 Americans are losing a paycheck because this crowd wants to play stupid political games. Disgraceful. https://twitter.com/samstein/status/1078657180516143105 QT @samstein Among Trump allies and inside the WH there is a growing appetite to keep the shutdown going, in part because they feel it messes up Pelosi’s return to the speakership and overshadows her agenda https://www.thedailybeast.com/team-trump-gleeful-that-shutdown-will-hijack-pelosis-big-moment?ref=home

With @swin24

RT @thehill Rep. Hakeem Jeffries: "If Mexico is going to pay for it, go negotiate with Mexico. Instead what [President Trump has] done is shut down the government and tried to stick the American taxpayer with a $5 billion ransom note to build a medieval border wall." https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/422910-trump-says-he-wants-to-visit-border-wall-before-state-of-the-union http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1078486483558981632/img/YOKK89Yt1mSZ92-T.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1078486483558981632/vid/320x180/dLeC_LTbMoGwfqKM.mp4?tag=9

Over and over, working people have shown that when they have power and organize, our society changes for the better. That’s why it’s critical we strengthen unions and make them available to every single worker.
The extraordinary power of the corporate establishment is not just over our economy and political life, it is over our imagination and our ability to envision a different kind of world.

I am thankful to have known Tyrone, and that his life touched so many people.
